msItem.title: Miracles of the Virgin
msItem.incipit: Quedam mangna domina cum duas ancillas haberet

msItem.title: Summa de uirtutibus 'Postquam'
msItem.incipit: Postquam dictum est de morbis ipsius anime, id est, de peccatis, addendum est de remediis

listBibl.bibl: S. Wenzel, 'The source for the 'Remedia' of the "Parson's Tale"', Traditio 27 (1971) (listed, ms. L).

msItem.title: Sermons
msItem.incipit: Sic currite ut comprehendatis Hec verba scripta sunt ad Cor. 9 et duo tangit apostolus

msItem.title: Texts on the Creed
msItem.incipit: Queso vos, fratres karissimi, ut expositionem simboli attentius audiatis
msItem.note: The first is Ps-Augustine, Serm. app. 242 (PL 39.2191-3) but others follow.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Sermo 59
msItem.incipit: Reddidi quid credatis ; audite quid oretis
msItem.bibl: H. R. Drobner, ‘Newly Identified Augustinian and Pseudo-Augustinian Texts in Manuscripts of Bodleian Library, Oxford’, Augustinianum, 55.2 (2015), pp. 513–41 at 522-3.

msItem.author: Gilbert Crispin
msItem.title: De monachatu siue epistula ad fratrem R. de uita monastica
msItem.incipit: Quesivit a me dilectio vestra, quid sit monachatus an prosit et ad que prosit
msItem.bibl: The Works of Gilbert Crispin ..., ed. A. S. Abulafia and G. R. Evans (1986), pp. 89-94, with variants from the present manuscript ('LL'): 'the text is inferior with many omissions' (p. xvi); the work is discussed ibid., p. xxv.

msItem.note: Followed by two exempla (1) a clerk possessed by a demon (2) a religious widow.

msItem.title: Glosses on Romans and I Corinthians
msItem.incipit: Paulus servus ... Augustinus in Enchiridion ; servitus quia servitur justitiae
msItem.explicit: [xi.27] Item, qui indevote, id est, irreverenter vel negligenter accedat

msItem.title: Sermon (?)
msItem.incipit: Hoc est corpus meum ... Decessurus quis ab amicis suis facit eis festum, sicut dominus Lucas, Desiderio desi- deravi. Sicut si quis peregre profectus traderet amico optimum electuarium in pixide

msItem.title: Sermons and notes for sermons (?)
msItem.incipit: Graciarum actio magis placet Deo in adversis quam in prosperis

msItem.title: Exhortatio Firmati monachi
msItem.incipit: Fratribus qui sunt in valle Christi, Sacer Firmatus flores salutaris scientie et inestimabilem fructum ligni vite clara et nullo unquam marcescens tempore sapiencia Deum in plateis clamitans
msItem.note: Firmatus identified by J. Leclerq as Guillaume Firmat, 11th century.
msItem.bibl: ed. J. Leclerq, 'L'Exhortation de Guillaume Firmat', Analecta Monastica 2nd. ser. = Studia Anselmiana fasc. 31 (1953), pp. 28-44; only this ms. cited.

msItem.note: Extracts on the infancy of Christ, the first from De ortu beatae mariae et de infantia saluatoris (Gospel of Pseudo-Matthew)
msItem.rubric: Ieronimus in libro de Infantia Salvatoris
msItem.incipit: Maria erat in admiratione omni populo Israel
msItem.note: Followed by 'Innocencius' on the name of Jesus, and 'Clemens' on Mary.

msItem.author: Ps.-Ignatius of Antioch
msItem.title: Epistola ad B. Virginem Mariam cum responsione

listBibl.bibl: ed. F. X. Funk and F. Diekamp, Patres Apostolici, II, Tubingae, 1913, pp. 321-322

msItem.author: Ps.-Ignatius of Antioch
msItem.title: Epistola ad B. Iohannem cum responsione
Homily on the Nativity of the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: Inquirendum est, fratres karissimi, et explanandum per ordinem
msItem.note: Adapted from a Latin redaction of the apocryphal Protevangelium Jacobi (BHL 5333m–t); ed. Jean-Daniel Kaestli, 'Le Protévangile de Jacques latin dans l’homélie Inquirendum est pour la fête de la Nativité de Marie', Apocrypha 12 (2001), 99–153

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De civitate dei
msItem.incipit: Augustinus in primo libro de civitate Dei, Scio quibus viribus opus sit, ut persuadeatur

msItem.title: De compositione chilindri
msItem.incipit: Investigantibus chilindri compositionem, qui dicitur Horologium viatorum

msItem.note: Followed by two exempla on the virtues of confession.

msItem.incipit: Cum ignoremus quid agere debeamus ; etc. Verba ista, karissimi, merito possum

msItem.rubric: Sermo fratris W. Cornubiensis in Cathedra S. Petri
msItem.incipit: Tibi dabo claves regni celorum Hodie karissimi beatus Petrus divina auctoritate curam assumpsit
msItem.note: Perhaps to be identified (as Sharpe, Latin Writers, s.n.) with William of Cornwall, OFM (for whom Emden, BRUO, I. 491).

msItem.title: Commentary on the Lord's Prayer
msItem.incipit: Pater noster; etc. Hec dominica oratio privilegiata est in tribus, in dignitate, in brevitate, in fecunditate
msItem.note: Identified by Bloomfield 8354, 8927, as Ps.-Bonaventure, De oratione dominica (Opera (Quaracchi) VII (1895), 652-655) but the text apparently differs after the opening sentences.

msItem.title: Commentary on Ave Maria
msItem.incipit: In ista salutacione Virginem in quatuor et a quatuor commendabilem denunciat

msItem.author: Cyprian of Carthage
msItem.title: De dominica oratione
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit sermo Cipriani de oratione Dominica
msItem.note: Followed by acrotics on the names of Jesus and Maria, and by seven 'urbanitates' and seven ''rusticitates'.

history.provenance: 'Thomas Gurney hoes thes boke ... ', mid 16th century, fol. 167v.
history.acquisition: Part of his first donation to the Bodleian, 1635.

recordHist.source:
Description adapted (2024) from the following sources, with additional reference to published literature as cited, and additional description of items 4, 20. H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885) S. J. P. van Dijk, Latin Liturgical Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, vol. 2: Office Books (typescript, 1957), p. 186
Quarto Catalogue, cols. 155–6 Quarto Catalogue, col. 157 Quarto Catalogue, p. 550 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 29

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: S. J. P. van Dijk, Latin Liturgical Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, vol. 2: Office Books (typescript, 1957), p. 186

Add binding information from Quarto Catalogue.
